channel.title: Ubuntu as Dual boot with XP
channel.description:
This is my problem, waited a few days in the official topic with no replies so i decided to post here ;D
This is my problem
[u][b]Bad Quality Video of it All[/b][/u] [url=http://youtube.com/watch?v=_8X8pXK-Lck]http://youtube.com/watch?v=_8X8pXK-Lck[/url]
[b] My current partitions [/b]
[img]http://img405.imageshack.us/img405/9926/pic1ij4.png[/img]
[b]Partition Manager[/b]
[img]http://img153.imageshack.us/img153/2493/pic2bd9.png[/img]
[b]Me typing in 10,000[/b]
[img]http://img521.imageshack.us/img521/2775/pic3jm1.png[/img]
[b]What happens automatically when i click off the text box[/b]
[img]http://img465.imageshack.us/img465/3227/pic4nz4.png[/img]
[b]Partitions after clicking yes[/b]
[img]http://img89.imageshack.us/img89/8977/pic5pm2.png[/img]
[b]My error when using the create a partition wizard[/b]
[img]http://img337.imageshack.us/img337/2775/pic6hi6.png[/img]
Thanks for looking and i hope you can help :)

item.title: Ubuntu as Dual boot with XP
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

What you are typing in is telling the program to resize your 70+gb windows partition to 10gb, which is not enough room. You probably want a 10gb partition for linux, so you want to resize your windows partition to something like 60gb, and then you won’t have problems.

Read full topic
item.source: Ubuntu as Dual boot with XP

item.description:
@iceburster wrote:

mrrules:

Just go to download.com and search for wubi… that installs it for you.

Read full topic
